7 RAREST pics of mysterious universe by NASA - India.com
summary:
7 RAREST pics of mysterious universe by NASA

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

This article highlights seven rare photographs of the universe captured by NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and mystery of our cosmos.

  • Asteroid Dimorphos captured on December 19, 2022.
  • ‘Spoke Season’ on Saturn observed from approximately 850 million miles away.
  • Image of the bright spiral galaxy MCG-01-24-014, located about 275 million light-years away.
  • UGC 8091 showcasing billions of glittering stars, resembling a snow globe.
  • Spiral galaxy NGC 6951 featuring bright blue spiral arms.
  • Rare Radio Galaxy NGC 612 exhibiting vibrant orange and blue streaks.
  • G35.2-0.7N region captured in stunning detail.
“These images not only provide scientific insight but also inspire awe about the universe we live in.”

The article emphasizes the importance of such images in understanding the universe's vastness and complexities, revealing both scientific and artistic marvels.
newTitle: 7 RAREST pics of mysterious universe by NASA

title: Virat Kohli, Sam Konstas’ shoulder-bump incident inspires Kerala Police's unique road safety advisory - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kerala Police’s advisory on road safety, which uses footage of Virat Kohli bumping into Sam Konstas’ shoulder, has left social media users chuckling.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The on-field shoulder bump between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas has inspired an innovative road safety advisory from the Kerala Police, cleverly repurposing viral footage to convey an important message about road safety.

  • The footage shows Kohli bumping into Konstas during a cricket match, leading to a humorous yet serious traffic safety campaign.
  • The Kerala Police emphasized the importance of following traffic rules through the video, stating: “It's okay to be ‘King’. Follow traffic rules. While keeping yourself safe, keep others safe too.”
  • The campaign aims to convey crucial road safety messages through clever visual metaphors, utilizing the bump to illustrate dangers on the road.
“I think emotions got to both of us...but it happens in cricket,” - Sam Konstas on the shoulder bump incident.

This fusion of sports and road safety awareness has resonated well with social media users, emphasizing how impactful public safety messages can be when presented in creative ways.
newTitle: Kerala Police Uses Viral Kohli Incident for Road Safety Advisory

title: Jimmy Carter, 39th U.S. President, dies at 100 - The Hindu
summary:
Jimmy Carter, 39th U.S. President, dies at 100

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Carter Center

Jimmy Carter, the longest-lived American President, passed away at the age of 100 on December 29, 2024, in Plains, Georgia, after 22 months in hospice care. He is remembered for his presidency during a tumultuous era, his humanitarian efforts, and his legacy as a global peacemaker.

  • Carter was in hospice care for 22 months before his death.
  • President Joe Biden mourned Carter as an extraordinary leader and dear friend.
  • Carter's post-presidential legacy includes founding The Carter Center and his work in global humanitarian efforts.
  • He is known for the Camp David Accords, negotiating peace in the Middle East.
  • Despite his challenges in office, Carter's post-presidency efforts earned him the Nobel Peace Prize in 2002.
“To all of the young people in this nation…study Jimmy Carter, a man of principle, faith, and humility.” – President Joe Biden

Carter's impact on American history is reassessed positively, acknowledging both his achievements and challenges during his presidency.
newTitle: Jimmy Carter, 39th U.S. President, dies at 100

title: ‘Pilot declared mayday’: What caused the Jeju Air plane crash in South Korea? - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Pilot declared mayday’: What caused the Jeju Air plane crash in South Korea?

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Jeju Air flight from Bangkok to South Korea crashed during landing, resulting in 179 deaths and only two survivors being rescued.

  • The plane was warned of a bird strike during its first landing attempt.
  • The pilot declared a “mayday” and attempted a belly landing.
  • All 175 passengers and four crew members died; only two flight attendants survived.
  • Investigations are examining a potential bird strike and adverse weather as causes.
  • Both flight data and cockpit voice recorders have been recovered.
“It really has to be a series of catastrophic events that led to such a high loss of life,” - Philip Butterworth-Hayes, aviation consultant.

This tragic incident has brought to light the aviation safety measures and the potential hazards involved in flight operations.
newTitle: Jeju Air Plane Crash in South Korea Leaves 179 Dead

title: Kangana Ranaut says hard-working women in Himachal are ‘equal or better looking’ than her, Preity Zinta, Yami Gautam - Hindustan Times

Kangana Ranaut Praises Hard-Working Himachali Women

Date: Dec 30, 2024

Kangana Ranaut, MP of Mandi and actor, highlighted the beauty and hard work of women in Himachal Pradesh, stating they deserve more recognition.

  • Kangana took to Instagram to share her thoughts and pictures alongside fellow actresses Preity Zinta and Yami Gautam.
  • She emphasized that women working in the fields are equally or more beautiful and deserve attention.
  • Ranaut has also spoken out in support of Blake Lively amidst controversies in the entertainment industry.
  • She recently faced issues with the release of her biopic on Indira Gandhi titled 'Emergency.'
“When I go to Himachal and see our women equally or better looking than us work tirelessly in the fields... I feel they can definitely do with some hype.”

This statement underscores Ranaut's appreciation for local women and calls for their recognition beyond the glamour of the film industry.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut Praises Hard-Working Himachali Women

title: Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’ | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

India’s fascination with gold is legendary, but platinum is quickly carving out its own space, especially among young consumers who want jewellery to mean more than a mere “store of value.”

  • High levels of awareness and consideration for platinum among consumers.
  • Sustained double-digit growth in platinum sales.
  • Expansion of platinum marketing efforts into tier-2 and tier-3 towns.
  • Consumer marketing director Sujala Martis discusses evolving consumer mindsets.
  • Focus on the emotive aspects of platinum compared to gold.
“Platinum is seen as a more meaningful choice among the younger generation, reflecting personal expression rather than just investment.”

The growing trend of young consumers seeking more from their jewellery indicates a significant shift in marketing for the platinum industry aimed at emotional connections.
newTitle: Platinum Guild Rides Wave of Popularity as Young Consumers Embrace Platinum Beyond Gold

title: NASA Confirms: Parker Probe Survives 'Touching Sun' in Record-Breaking Flyby - ScienceAlert
summary:
NASA Confirms: Parker Probe Survives 'Touching Sun' in Record-Breaking Flyby

Date: December 24th, 2024

Source: Universe Today

The Parker Solar Probe made its closest approach to the Sun, passing just 6 million km above the surface and achieving a velocity of about 692,000 km/h. NASA confirmed that the probe successfully transmitted a beacon tone after the flyby.

  • The Parker Probe broke the previous distance record set by Helios 2.
  • It became the fastest human-made object, reaching speeds of around 692,000 km/h.
  • It conducted science operations during close passes to enhance our understanding of solar wind origins.
  • Its journey began with gravity-assist maneuvers involving Venus.
  • The probe's carbon foam shield protects it from extreme temperatures in the solar corona.
"Flying this close to the Sun is a historic moment in humanity's first mission to a star..." - Nicky Fox, NASA Associate Administrator

The Parker Solar Probe continues to provide critical data that could transform our understanding of solar phenomena and their effects on space weather.
newTitle: NASA Confirms: Parker Probe Survives 'Touching Sun' in Record-Breaking Flyby

Jimmy Carter, 39th US President and winner of Nobel Prize, dies at 100 - The Indian Express
summary:
Jimmy Carter, the 39th and longest-lived US President, dies at 100

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Former US President Jimmy Carter has passed away aged 100, marking the end of a significant era in American politics as he was the longest-lived president in history.

  • Carter served as President from 1977 to 1981, facing numerous foreign policy challenges.
  • He was defeated in the 1981 re-election bid by Ronald Reagan.
  • His foundation, the Carter Center, announced his passing, citing various health ailments, including melanoma.
  • In 2002, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his global humanitarian efforts.
  • The Carter Center monitored around 113 elections worldwide, advocating for democracy and human rights.
“To all of the young people in this nation and for anyone in search of what it means to live a life of purpose and meaning – the good life, study Jimmy Carter, a man of principle, faith, and humility.” - President Joe Biden

A state funeral has been ordered for Jimmy Carter in Washington, as recognized by President Biden.
newTitle: Jimmy Carter, the 39th and longest-lived US President, dies at 100

South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Biden offers US assistance to South Korea after plane crash - The Indian Express
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date: January 1, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

In an emergency meeting on Sunday, South Korea’s acting President Choi Sang-mok declared a national mourning period until January 4 following the deadly plane crash at Muan International Airport that killed 179. All on board except two crew members are feared dead as a plane carrying 181 passengers and six crew on a flight from Bangkok to South Korea’s Muan International Airport crashed and burst into flames early Sunday.

  • The crash occurred at around 9 am local time during the plane's landing.
  • The flight was a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 carrying 175 passengers and 6 crew members.
  • Most of the passengers are believed to be South Koreans, with two Thai nationals on board.
  • Acting President Choi Sang-mok expressed condolences and ordered all-out rescue efforts.
  • The crash site has been declared a special disaster zone.
The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence. - Choi Sang-mok

The incident has raised significant concerns about aviation safety and has prompted US assistance offers.
newTitle: South Korea Plane Crash: US Offers Assistance After 179 Confirmed Dead

title: PM Narendra Modi hails legendary ANR in Maan ki Baat’s latest episode - 123telugu
summary:
PM Narendra Modi hails legendary ANR in Maan ki Baat’s latest episode

Published on Dec 29, 2024 11:56 pm IST

The Akkineni family and the Telugu film industry celebrated the centenary birth anniversary of legendary actor Akkineni Nageswara Rao (ANR). Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged ANR's contributions to Indian cinema in the latest episode of his audio series, Mann ki Baat.

  • India honored ANR with a special stamp for his 100th birth anniversary.
  • A retrospective of ANR's classic films was featured at the International Film Festival of India in Goa.
  • PM Modi praised ANR for taking Telugu cinema to new heights and preserving Indian culture through his films.
  • Modi also paid tribute to other cinema legends like Raj Kapoor and Mohammad Rafi during this episode.
“Akkineni Nageswara Rao garu, with his contribution, took Telugu Cinema to new heights. In his films, Indian culture, heritage, and value system have been promoted and highlighted with great enthusiasm and honesty,” said PM Modi.

ANR's career was marked by prestigious awards including the Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan, Padma Shri, and Dada Saheb Phalke Awards, recognizing his invaluable contributions to cinema.
newTitle: PM Modi Celebrates ANR's Legacy in Latest Mann ki Baat Episode

title: Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179 | Top updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The tragic Jeju Air flight 7C2216 crash has raised significant questions regarding the actual cause, with experts disputing the likelihood of a bird strike leading to the aircraft's malfunction.

  • The plane was landing at Muan International Airport when it crashed, resulting in the death of 179 people.
  • Experts argue that a bird strike could not have solely caused the malfunctioning of the landing gear.
  • Survivors of the crash are stable and conscious but the majority of passengers have not been identified.
  • The South Korean government declared a period of national mourning following the incident.
“At this point there are a lot more questions than we have answers.” - Gregory Alegi, aviation expert

The ongoing investigation into the crash continues as authorities examine the factors that contributed to this tragic event.
newTitle: Experts Question Bird Strike Hypothesis in Fatal South Korea Plane Crash
